creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: European subject; each painted in grisaille, flesh tones and gilt with bearded figure embracing a seated lady beneath draped canopy; smokey glaze
medium: Porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration
text: Decorated en grisaille, or in black enamel, the central scene, which has not been identified, derives from a European print. The scene may be biblical as the man wears a Jewish-style hat. Religious subjects became popular decoration on export porcelain during the 1740s, as more biblical engravings were sent to China.
title: Plate
